experience.title: Policy Research Intern
experience.description: Objective:•Historically track down the Foreign Exchange Market structure of India from the pre-independence days to the current day•Analyze the effects of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA), 1999 on the Balance of Payments (BoP) Account of IndiaStrategy:•Chronological approach beginning with studying the impact of British Rule on the foreign exchange economy of India•Studied different exchange rate regimes, trade policies, govt. policies and geopolitical factors leading to the 1991 BoP crisis •Leveraged RBI Database to analyze impacts of 1991 BoP crisis, the LPG reforms and FEMA 1999 on the Indian economyConclusion:•Severe need for ‘opening-up’ of the Indian economy after the dreadful economic conditions in the 1970s and the 1980s•FEMA 1999 has positively impacted FDI, FPI, forex reserves, external trade, GDP growth in India since the 2000s decade
